info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:01PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Cluster of thunderstorms over northeast Nevada lifting northeast toward the Graham Peak fire through 500 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms 18 miles southwest of Oakley Reservoir, moving northeast at 20 mph. The leading cell would likely arrive around 5 PM MDT with possibly stronger cells trailing behind through 6 PM MDT if they maintain their current strength and track. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 30 mph, pea size hail, occasional lighting, and periods of moderate rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and create difficult firefighting conditions on area fires. Locations impacted include... Oakley Reservoir and City Of Rocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Fire crews working near the Graham Peak fire should prepare for strong, gusty and erratic thunderstorm outflow winds that may increase fire behavior or blow around loose ash.
